subject: Programming
title: Breadth-First and Depth-First Search
description: A quick win: understand Breadth-First and Depth-First Search.

hook.text: BFS explores level by level, like ripples in a pond. DFS dives deep, like exploring a maze.

buildup.text: BFS uses a queue to visit the closest nodes first. DFS uses a stack to go as deep as possible.

discovery.text: BFS finds the shortest path in unweighted graphs. DFS detects cycles and explores all branches.

twist.text: Neither is universally better. The problem determines which traversal gives the right answer fastest.

climax.text: Web crawlers use BFS. Puzzle solvers use DFS. Both are fundamental tools in every programmer's kit.
